intro: Ptyssiglottis densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered ptyssiglottis, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its dense inflorescence and aromatic foliage make it a distinctive member of its native flora. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in New Zealand's ecosystems.
